data.title: Sunset View
data.statement:
You are given the heights [[h]] of [[N]] buildings in an east-to-west order. Every building has windows facing west (where the sun sets).

Your program outputs the heights [[h]] and indices [[i]] of those buildings that have sunset view in east to west order. A building can view the sunset if the height [[h]] of <<every>> building to the west of the building is <<strictly lower>> than its own height [[h]].
First building is at index 0.
data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
loop N read h:int
write 17 [0]
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of buildings.
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> An integer [[h]] representing the height of a building.
data.outputDescription:
A single line containing the heights [[h]] and the indices [[i]], between square brackets, of all buildings with sunset view separated by a single whitespace, e.g.:
{{7 [2] 5 [5] 3 [8] 1 [9]}}

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are given the heights h of N buildings in an east-to-west order. Every building has windows facing west (where the sun sets).

Your program outputs the heights h and indices i of those buildings that have sunset view in east to west order. A building can view the sunset if the height h of every building to the west of the building is strictly lower than its own height h.
First building is at index 0.
Input
Line 1: An integer N for the number of buildings.
Next N lines: An integer h representing the height of a building.
Output
A single line containing the heights h and the indices i, between square brackets, of all buildings with sunset view separated by a single whitespace, e.g.:
7 [2] 5 [5] 3 [8] 1 [9]
Constraints
0 < N ≤ 20
All heights h > 0
Example
Input
9
17
15
5
10
12
8
2
5
4
Output
17 [0] 15 [1] 12 [4] 8 [5] 5 [7] 4 [8]
